reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really want people to play this game! It's a cute idea that seems like a blast to play with friends. However, the game needs more people playing it. If you're on the fence about buying it, here is what you should know:

Pros:
-Cheap! Game is a steal honestly. Its not at its peak value yet because of the small playerbase, but it's a tiny investment.
-Simple concept. Gets the job done with streamlined gameplay that really gets to the core of class based shooter." Doesn't really fit that title much
date:
but its more akin to TF2 than other games.
-Quick rounds! Doesn't take long to play honestly which is great! Haven't played with people yet but should be a blast with friends!

Cons:
-Game simply doesn't look all that nice. This helps gameplay by simplifying interactions with very little clutter and helps keep the game running smoothly on any machine

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is VERY VERY early. But Warriors and Castles shows promise. The developers are dedicated to it and are actively working on it. The price is very cheap, and this makes it a great candidate for a party game with friends. The system requirements are modest (though it does need some optimization.) The idea is somewhat like Chivalry Medieval Warfare, though it is much simpler. There are currently three classes, Warrior, Archer, and Wizard. Their functions are relatively self explanatory, and the type of game I've played is a battle in which there are two castles, you must breach the gates of your enemy castle. The dev's are working on setting up dedicated servers, and the game does contain a decent enough AI which does allow the AI to be able to complete any objectives. The Wizard seems a bit underpowered as his abilities are defensive. He can fire a magic missile, which I think does more damage than an arrow. He can heal himself and I am pretty sure heal allies, but Warriors have a spinning attack which can only be countered but a warrior holding his shield up. This spinning attack as a large radious and can wipe out a cluster of enemies pretty quickly. The game is in very early stages of development, it is no where near it's final product. But since the developers are very active and EXCEPTIONALLY responsive to suggestions and criticism, this game is definitely worth supporting.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MVGYq0tIvwA

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is simple and fun, no class is overpowered, no class is underpowered.

There are 2 sides, red, and blue; each side has the three simple classes known to many people, Archer, Mage, and Knight.
The visuals are nice and simplistic, nothing complex like other games, which makes it kind of nice to play, except for the fact that no one is on (due to the fast that this is a 'new' game).
The controls are the same as other games, you have your class, the special skills, your weapon (which can either discharge something or slice).

There are 3 gamemodes; castle conquer, capture the flag, and moba, all self explanatory, but I'll list them out anyways:

Castle Conquer - Your team's job is to destroy the other's castle, and defend yours.

Moba - An arena for people to enjoy, kill a few people whilst there.

Capture the Flag - Stand and hold your position over the flag in the town square.

Knight - The melee user, you have your shield and your weapon; your special skill is 'spin-and-slice' as I like to call it, fairly easy class to use, vulnerable to mages and archers at far range. The shield can block arrows depending on where they land (obviously it won't block if it hits you in the head), good if you can manage to get close enough.

1st skill - Slice-and-dice, twirl around and slice people for 5 seconds
2nd skill - Quick-dash, run fast enough to catch up to an opponent or get behind them

Archer - The long-range user, it's exactly what it sounds like, you sit form afar and shoot arrows till your enemy dies. Close range is fairly weak, so I suggest far range. Vulnerable to mage and knights.

1st skill - Arrow-band, shoot 7 arrows at your enemy(ies) for maximum efficiency.
2nd skill - Bear-trap, set up a trap below you for enemies to fall into.

Mage - This class is neither long-ranged nor short ranged, meaning that, it doesn't shoot quite as far as the archer, but it does shoot far enough. He shoots out colored clouds (the color depends on your team's), and has melee like the archer. I suggest staying away from the Knights, due to the fact that they have shields and don't penetrate ( ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ) the character.

1st skill - Wall, summon up a wall before you with the same color as your team.
2nd skill - Heal-well, heal up to as many of your mates (provided they're in your circle) for 5         seconds.

Overall, the game is fun, I definitely recommend buying it, and it's obviously incomplete (Early Access, duh), but I trust the developers with a game like this, adding cosmetics, new skills, features, that would be awesome (especially hats, costumes, stuff like that).

Thank you for your time ^^
